alert.note: Alert for Southern Highlands; Western Twin Falls BLM (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 06 at 2:21PM MDT until September 08 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY WILL CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE EASTERN PAYETTE AND NORTHERN BOISE NATIONAL FORESTS... ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY WILL CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING ACROSS MUCH OF THE PAYETTE AND NORTHERN BOISE NATIONAL FORESTS...AS WELL AS ACROSS THE BURNS AND VALE BLM ZONES... ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY MAY CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING ACROSS PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL IDAHO... .Southwest winds will increase this afternoon especially in eastern portions of zones 402 and 403. A red flag warning will continue today for areas east of McCall and Warm Lake and does not include the Four Corners Fire. An upper level trough and associated dry cold front will approach the region Wednesday afternoon. The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity will result in critical fire weather conditions across portions of southeast Oregon and the Idaho Forest zones. Additionally, isolated thunderstorms may produce gusty, erratic outflow winds and may increase fire spread. Gusty northwest winds will continue across south central Idaho on Thursday with low relative humidity, which may result in critical fire weather conditions. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR WESTERN TWIN FALLS BLM AND SOUTHERN HIGHLANDS...WHICH ARE FIRE WEATHER ZONES 424 AND 426... The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * WINDS...west to northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...8 to 13 percent.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Southern Highlands; Western Twin Falls BLM
